did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Seven volumes of typed lecture notes, lab exercises, and class handouts related to landscape architecture, horticulture, and agricultural economics.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Cornell University Class of 1947, earning a bachelor's degree in horticulture. Strander was a landscape architect and nurseryman, operating Strander Evergreen Nurseries from 1947 to 1967 in Tukwila, Washington. He was a civic leader in Tukwila, serving as a planning commissioner and later as mayor (1962-1967).

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Seven volumes of typed lecture notes, lab exercises, and class handouts related to landscape architecture, horticulture, and agricultural economics.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: John Strander Student Notebooks, #37-5-4076. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: General Phytopathology - two volumes - Professor D.S. Welch
Floriculture and Ornamental Horticulture - Professor Dr. Kenneth Post
Plant Physiology, Propogation, Breeding - Professor D.G. Clark
Edaphology - "The Study of the Soil" - Professor Harry Buckman
Woody Plant Materials - "Taxonomy of Trees and Shrubs" - Professor Ralph Curtis
"Landscape and Planning and Planting for Small Home Properties" by Joseph P. Porter and Robert Reich
